slides.title: Pygame Python Workshop
points: Our Pygame workshop will guide students through the process of coding a 2D platformer game in Python. Prior knowledge of Python is highly recommended.
Mentors will guide the students to complete the game development in a single 2.5 hour session.
Students will learn many of the game development fundamentals and various python concepts.
All assets are provided and students will be taken through each step of the process collaboratively.

slides.title: Course Layout Information
points: Basic procedural map generation and camera movement with the character
Game design stages (brainstorm, prototype, playtesting, debugging, and polishing)
Drawing and updating to the screen
Handling user input and switching through scenes

slides.title: Course Prerequisites
points: Students will need a discord account. Our workshop will take place on discord.
Students will need internet access during our workshop. If they wish to verbally ask questions, they will need a working mic, though it is not a requirement since they can still type their questions.
Students will need intermediate experience with python.
Rather than download software, students will use repl.it, a free online browser IDE. We will show students how to set it up, though directions are available here.
